workout.q: All progress takes place outside the comfort zone.
You may not be there yet, but you are closer than you were yesterday
A little progress each day adds up to big results
Most people fail, not because of lack of desire, but, because of lack of commitment.
Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
The first time I see a jogger smiling, I’ll consider it.
Look in the mirror. That’s your competition.
Tough times don’t last. Tough people do.
Put all excuses aside and remember this: You are capable.
If you think lifting is dangerous, try being weak. Being weak is dangerous.
The groundwork for all happiness is good health.
The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
Our bodies are our gardens – our wills are our gardeners.
If you don’t find the time, if you don’t do the work, you don’t get the results.
The vision of a champion is bent over, drenched in sweat, at the point of exhaustion, when nobody else is looking.
If something stands between you and your success, move it. Never be denied.
It’s going to be a journey. It’s not a sprint to get in shape.
Today I will do what others won’t, so tomorrow I can accomplish what others can’t.
Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person’s determination.
We can push ourselves further. We always have more to give.
I know that if I set my mind to something, even if people are saying I can’t do it, I will achieve it.
Confidence comes from discipline and training.
If it doesn’t challenge you, it won’t change you.

life.q: If all the world is a stage and life is just a play upon it, get me two seats in the stalls.
Don't go through life, GROW through life.
In life, as in chess, forethought wins.
Success is following the pattern of life one enjoys most.
If all the world is a stage and life is just a play upon it, get me two seats in the stalls.
A well written life is almost as rare as a well spent one.
Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
One life - a little gleam of Time between two Eternities.
The best thing to do with the best things in life is to give them up.
A life of leisure and a life of laziness are two different things.
Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
Do not take life too seriously; you will never get out of it alive.
The best use of life is to spend it for something that outlasts life.
Live you life while you have it. Life is a splendid gift - there is nothing small about it.
Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
Character develops itself in the stream of life.
Our care should not be to have lived long as to have lived enough.
Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.

success.q: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
Try not to become a man of success but rather to become a man of value.
Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
It is no use saying We are doing our best. You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
The first and most important step toward success is the feeling that we can succeed.
The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
Nobody succeeds beyond his or her wildest expectations unless he or she begins with some wild expectations.
Always bear in mind that your own resolution to success is more important than any other one thing.
The path to success is to take massive, determined action.
Put your heart, mind, intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
It is not the going out of the port, but the coming in, that determines the success of a voyage.
Often a certain abdication of prudence and foresight is an element of success.
The surest way not to fail is to determine to succeed.
Success is a journey, not a destination.
Success is where preparation and opportunity meet.
Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
Success is the progressive realization of predetermined, worthwhile, personal goals.
Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
